StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Genetic Epidemiology of COPD (COPDGene)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://topmed.nhlbi.nih.gov/acknowledgements
In addition, please include: "This research used data generated by the COPDGene study, which was supported by NIH grants U01 HL089856 and U01 HL089897. The COPDGene project is also supported by the COPD Foundation through contributions made by an Industry Advisory Board comprised of Pfizer, AstraZeneca, Boehringer Ingelheim, Novartis, and Sunovion."
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: There are two consent groups in COPDGene: • Disease-Specific: Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees. • Health/Medical/Biomedical: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (COPD and Smoking, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CS-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to COPD and Smoking and related disorders.
Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees.

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area
ConsentGroup.name: EA
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use by NHLBI WGS study investigators only There are two consent groups for this study: HMB and DS-CS-RD / Disease-Specific (COPD and Smoking, RD): For HMB: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. For DS-CS-RD: Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees.

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Genetic Epidemiology of COPD (COPDGene)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://www.nhlbiwgs.org/acknowledgements
In addition, please include: "This research used data generated by the COPDGene study, which was supported by NIH grants U01 HL089856 and U01 HL089897. The COPDGene project is also supported by the COPD Foundation through contributions made by an Industry Advisory Board comprised of Pfizer, AstraZeneca, Boehringer Ingelheim, Novartis, and Sunovion."
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: There are two consent groups in COPDGene: • Disease-Specific, Methods: Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). • Health/Medical/Biomedical, Methods: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (COPD and Smoking, MDS, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CS-MDS-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to COPD and Smoking and related disorders. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees.

ConsentGroup.name: EA
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use by NHLBI WGS study investigators only There are two consent groups for this study: HMB-MDS and DS-CS-MDS-RD / Disease-Specific (COPD and Smoking, MDS, RD: For HMB-MDS: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). For DS-CS-MDS-RD: Use of this data is limited to studies of COPD and other smoking-related disorders. The full list of diseases or conditions for which smoking is considered to be a risk factor can be found at: www.copdgene.org/smoking-related-disorders. The institutional certification assured that data submission was compliant with, and limited to, local and federal policies, and Massachusetts state law; To the extent possible, consideration was given to individuals and groups for subsequent data sharing and are reviewed by the National Institutes of Health’s Data Access Committees. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
